item.title: Israel-Backed Gaza Food Plan Starts Amid Dissent, Delay
item.description: The Gaza Humanitarian Foundation, a new Swiss-based nonprofit, said it began distributing food to Palestinians in the war-ravaged Gaza Strip and appointed a new executive director following earlier setbacks.
item.dc:creator: Dan Williams

media:content.media:description: Palestinian children at a food point in the Nuseirat refugee camp in central Gaza, on May 24.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg Loves MAGA Now. Will MAGA Ever Love Him Back?
item.description: Meta’s CEO has done everything he can to win over Trump, and it’s not clear how much he has to show for it.
item.dc:creator: Riley Griffin, Kurt Wagner

media:content.media:description: Mark Zuckerberg says recent changes to Meta’s content policies reflect an authentic representation of his personal views.

item.title: Trump to Pardon Sheriff Found Guilty of ‘Cash-for-Badges’ Scheme
item.description: President Donald Trump said he would be pardoning a former Virginia sheriff facing a 10-year prison sentence after being convicted of bribery and fraud charges.
item.dc:creator: Jennifer A Dlouhy

media:content.media:description: President Donald Trump speaks during the Memorial Day wreath-laying ceremony in Arlington National Cemetery on May 26, 2025.

item.title: King Charles Visits Canada as Country Rattled by Trump Taunts
item.description: King Charles III arrived in Canada to open a new parliamentary session at the invitation of Prime Minister Mark Carney, a move designed in part to send a message to US President Donald Trump about the northern country’s sovereignty.
item.dc:creator: Brian Platt

media:content.media:description: King Charles III and Queen Camilla arrive at Ottawa Airport on Monday.

item.title: Multiple People Taken to Hospitals After Shooting Incident in South Carolina Beach Town
item.description: LITTLE RIVER, S.C. (AP) — Ten people were shot during a fight that started after a private boat hosting a holiday weekend party arrived at a dock Sunday night on the South Carolina coast, authorities said.

item.title: US Money Managers Put on Notice by $65 Billion Dutch Investor
item.description: Dutch pension fund PME is issuing a blanket warning to US money managers, amid concerns America’s investment industry is caving in to pressure from the Trump administration to abandon basic principles of stewardship.
item.dc:creator: Frances Schwartzkopff

media:content.media:description: President Trump signs executive orders during a ceremony in the Oval Office following the inauguration of his second term.

item.title: South Korean Election: Can a New President Bring Back Stability?
item.description: South Koreans are set to finally choose a new president after the nation’s worst constitutional crisis in decades.
item.dc:creator: Soo-Hyang Choi

media:content.media:description: Lee Jae-myung Photographer: Woohae Cho/Bloomberg

item.title: Charles Rangel, a Voice for the Poor in Tax Debates, Dies at 94
item.description: Charles Rangel, the dapper, voluble US congressman from New York’s Harlem district who for four decades used his perch on the House tax-writing committee to advocate for inner cities and the people who live there, has died. He was 94.
item.dc:creator: Laurence Arnold

media:content.media:description: Charles Rangel in 2014.

item.title: Chile’s Leftist Presidential Hopefuls Spar Over SQM-Codelco Deal
item.description: Chile’s left-leaning presidential contenders clashed over a landmark deal signed last year between lithium supplier SQM and state-owned Codelco, highlighting differences ahead of the sector’s primary vote.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Malinowski

media:content.media:description: Jeannette Jara speaks to members of the media after registering her candidacy in Santiago on April 30.

item.title: NATO Chief Rutte Says Members Moving Toward 5% Spending Target
item.description: NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte confirmed the alliance will seek to adopt a new defense spending target of 5% of GDP at a June summit, meeting a demand by US President Donald Trump that had originally seemed unrealistic.
item.dc:creator: Andrea Palasciano, Max Ramsay

media:content.media:description: Mark Rutte

item.title: Merz Gives Ukraine Green Light to Strike Deep Inside Russia
item.description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz said Ukraine has been given permission to use weapons supplied by its allies to launch strikes deep inside Russia.
item.dc:creator: Patrick Donahue, Michael Nienaber

media:content.media:description: Ukrainian artillerymen launch a missile attack on Russian military positions in Donetsk Oblast, Ukraine.

item.title: Trump Threatens to Send Harvard Grant Money to Trade Schools
item.description: President Donald Trump on Monday threatened to divert billions in grant dollars away from Harvard University and give those funds to trade schools across the US, escalating his clash with the elite institution.
item.dc:creator: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Janet Lorin

media:content.media:description: The Harvard University campus in Cambridge, Massachusetts, US, on Monday, May 5, 2025. President Donald Trump said Harvard University would lose its tax-exempt status, stepping up his attack on the Ivy League school with a threat that was decried as out of his jurisdiction.

item.title: EU Plans to ‘Fast Track’ Trade Talks With US Amid Tariff Fight
item.description: The European Union said it agreed to accelerate negotiations with the US to avoid a transatlantic trade war, signaling a more amicable approach just days after President Donald Trump criticized the bloc for taking advantage of the US and slow-walking talks.
item.dc:creator: Jorge Valero

item.title: Maduro Sweeps Venezuelan Regional Vote Marked by Low Turnout
item.description: Venezuela’s ruling party swept regional and parliamentary elections in a landslide Sunday, tightening President Nicolás Maduro’s grip on power after a low-turnout vote marred by widespread opposition abstention and international criticism.
item.dc:creator: Andreina Itriago, Patricia Laya

media:content.media:description: Nicolas Maduro waves to supporters as he celebrates the results of the parliamentary and regional elections at Bolivar Square in Caracas on May 25, 2025. Photographer: Federico Parra/AFP/Getty Images

item.title: Ukraine’s Zelenskiy Said to Meet With Merz in Berlin Wednesday
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy is set to travel to Berlin Wednesday for talks with Chancellor Friedrich Merz, according to a person familiar with his plans.
item.dc:creator: Michael Nienaber

media:content.media:description: Volodymyr Zelenskiy Photographer: Leon Sadiki/Bloomberg

item.title: Germany’s Merz Floats Cutting Off EU Funds to Fico’s Slovakia
item.description: Germany would consider suspending European Union funding to Slovakia if the country continues to diverge from the bloc’s shared direction, according to Chancellor Friedrich Merz.
item.dc:creator: Michael Nienaber, Michal Kubala

media:content.media:description: Robert Fico Photographer: Atdhe Mulla/Bloomberg

item.title: Germany Calls Ugandan Claims of Subversive Activities ‘Absurd’
item.description: Germany said allegations that its ambassador to Uganda was involved in subversive activities were “absurd,” after the East African nation said it was suspending military cooperation.
item.dc:creator: Fred Ojambo

media:content.media:description: The Ugandan parliament building in Kampala. Photographer: Luke Dray/Bloomberg

item.title: ‘Revenge Tax’: US Bill Hits Allies That Have Tax Rules Trump Doesn’t Like
item.description: Investors in nations with tax regimes that the US deems unfair would face higher tax rates on income earned in the US if the tax bill that’s making its way to the Senate becomes law.
item.dc:creator: Melissa Shin

media:content.media:description: The office of US House Speaker Mike Johnson, a Republican from Louisiana, in the US Capitol in Washington, DC, US, on Thursday, May 22, 2025. President Donald Trump's signature tax bill narrowly passed the House Thursday morning, overcoming fierce Republican infighting and advancing a sprawling multi-trillion dollar package that would avert a year-end tax increase at the expense of adding to the US debt burden.

item.title: Germany’s Merz Says US Tech Perks Could Be Target in Trade War
item.description: The European Union could retaliate against US technology companies if the trade conflict with Donald Trump’s administration escalates, German Chancellor Friedrich Merz said.
item.dc:creator: Michael Nienaber

media:content.media:description: Friedrich Merz

item.title: Tusk Plan to Change Poland Turns on Knife-Edge Election Race
item.description: Poland’s two presidential candidates are heading into the final week of a neck-and-neck election campaign that risks leaving Prime Minister Donald Tusk boxed in by a nationalist rival.
item.dc:creator: Piotr Bujnicki, Piotr Skolimowski

media:content.media:description: Rafal Trzaskowski, his wife and Donald Tusk walk marching with supporters on May 25, 2025.

item.title: Macron Vows Closer Defense, Energy Ties in Visit to Vietnam
item.description: French President Emmanuel Macron vowed closer cooperation on defense, transport and nuclear energy after talks with Vietnam’s leaders as he kicked off a tour of Southeast Asia aimed at shoring up alliances in the region.
item.dc:creator: Francesca Stevens, Nguyen Xuan Quynh, Samy Adghirni

media:content.media:description: Emmanuel Macron arrives at Noi Bai International Airport in Hanoi on May 25. Photographer: Ludovic Marin/AFP/Getty Images

item.title: Russia Dismisses Trump’s Putin Criticism as ‘Emotional’ Reaction
item.description: The Kremlin Monday brushed aside President Donald Trump’s criticism of Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin as an “emotional reaction” and defended the deadly campaign of missile and drone attacks across Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Henry Meyer

media:content.media:description: Vladimir Putin Photographer: Maxim Shemetov/AFP

item.title: Chinese, EU Trade Heads to Meet as Trump Tariff Tensions Rise
item.description: Top trade officials from the European Union and China are planning to meet again early next month, another sign that both sides are stepping up engagements as they try to push back against tariff pressure from Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: Colum Murphy, Jorge Valero

media:content.media:description: He Lifeng with Maros Sefcovic on March 27, in Beijing.

item.title: Trump Extends Deadline for 50% Tariffs on EU Goods to July 9
item.description: President Donald Trump said he would extend the deadline for the European Union to face 50% tariffs until July 9 after a phone call with Commission President Ursula von der Leyen.
item.dc:creator: Jennifer A Dlouhy

media:content.media:description: US President Donald Trump walks to speak to members of the media before boarding Air Force One at Morristown Municipal Airport in Morristown, New Jersey, May 25, 2025.

item.title: Romania’s Math Whiz President Faces Tough Budget Arithmetic
item.description: The ballot numbers added up for Romania’s Nicusor Dan, the one-time math prodigy who defeated a formidable far-right challenger to win the Black Sea nation’s presidency this month.
item.dc:creator: Irina Vilcu, Andra Timu

media:content.media:description: Nicusor Dan Photographer: Alexandra Corcode/Bloomberg

item.title: Trump Says He’s Eyeing Russia Sanctions, Calls Putin ‘Crazy’
item.description: President Donald Trump said he was “absolutely” considering new sanctions against Russia as Ukraine said Moscow launched its largest drone barrage of the war during a third night of strikes.
item.dc:creator: Jennifer A Dlouhy

media:content.media:description: Rescue workers at the site of a Russian missile attack in Kyiv on May 25.

item.title: Former Austrian Chancellor Kurz Acquitted of Perjury on Appeal
item.description: An Austrian appeals court acquitted former Chancellor Sebastian Kurz of perjury, clearing one legal obstacle for the once high-flying political prodigy who has pivoted to build a career in international finance.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Tirone

media:content.media:description: Sebastian Kurz leaves court in Vienna on May 26.

item.title: Trump’s Pivot Back to Tariffs Roils World Anew
item.description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
item.dc:creator: Philip Heijmans

media:content.media:description: Anwar Ibrahim, Malaysia's prime minister, center, during the 46th Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) Summit in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, on Monday, May 26, 2025. Southeast Asian leaders start two days of talks from Monday, seeking to deepen ties with China and Gulf nations, and mitigate the fallout from US President Donald Trump’s tariff hikes. Photographer: Samsul Said/Bloomberg

item.title: Finland Summons Russia’s Ambassador After Violation of Airspace
item.description: Finland summoned the Russian ambassador to provide an explanation for a recent suspected violation of airspace.
item.dc:creator: Kati Pohjanpalo

media:content.media:description: A Finnish Air Force F/A-18 Hornet pilot checks his aircraft wing during a NATO air force exercise in April. Photographer: John Thys/AFP/Gety Images

item.title: Israeli Military Aims to Take Over 75% of Gaza in Two Months
item.description: Israel aims to take control of 75% of the Gaza Strip and move its 2 million inhabitants into three designated areas as part of a new military offensive in the coastal strip.
item.dc:creator: Ian Fisher

media:content.media:description: The Israeli military conduct operations along the northern Gaza Strip border on May 20, 2025. Photographer: Mostafa Alkharouf/Anadolu/Getty Images
